mst June, 1699.— No time was allowed to ’the Venetian shipwrights to purify their consciences by sacramental confession, they are kept working as hard as they can by the Czar, toiling without rest at shipbuilding.

5th, ‘Gth July, 1699.-A Russian merchant claimed a debt of four roubles from a certain Ger- man for goods bought. When the German denied that he owed so much, the Russian with much voci- feration, several times most atrociously calling on all the powers celestial and infernal to witness, en- deavored to prove his claim. So the German ap- pointed the Russian arbiter on his proffered oath3 who thereupon entering the nearest church, falsely made the requisite oath. In a short time after he himself confessed that the German did not owe him four roubles, but only two3 that the other two were due to him by another, also a German, and that he could claim them in turn.
